_description: What Envy is Like — four lines

BLHar7322.Transcription:
RoteþAnd brenneþHit freteþand
                    twynneþÞe worm on þe treoand þe hul on
                    þe seeand roust on þe knifand ase deþ to þe
                    lif
BLHar7322.Note:
The first stanza is separated from the secon by a Latin line. To the
                    left of the indented second stanza, and linked to it by rubricated lines, is
                    ‘Ase’.
BLHar7322.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 230; rev. ed. 257.
Bloomfield,  Morton. 
             The Seven Deadly Sins….
         East Lansing, MI: Michigan State College Press, 1952: 166.
